what happened to the actor who played frost on rizzoli and isles

Answer:

Answer: The actor who played Frost on "Rizzoli & Isles," Lee Thompson Young, passed away in 2013. His death was ruled a suicide.

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
what happened to the actor who played frost on rizzoli and isles

['Ri’chard was considered for the role of Barry Frost in Rizzoli & Isles but the role was given to Lee Thompson Young.\n', 'Swifty Lazar appears as a character in Peter Morgan\'s stage play "Frost/Nixon", first staged at the Donmar Warehouse, London on August 10, 2006 and played by actor Kerry Shale. In the play, Lazar negotiates a deal with David Frost on behalf of President Richard Nixon for Frost to interview Nixon. The play is closely based on real-life events. He was also portrayed by Toby Jones in the 2008 film version of "Frost/Nixon". Swifty Lazar also appeared, thinly disguised as Irving "Sneaky" LaSalle, in George Axelrod\'s 1956 take on Dr. Faustus, the play "Will Success Spoil Rock Hunter" where Sneaky as an agent, will get his clients absolutely anything they want for 10% of their soul. The Lazar role was played on Broadway by Martin Gable.\n', 'Ross\' first television role was as an extra on "The Young and the Restless", which was followed by a small part in "Hill Street Blues" and the male lead in the music video for Whitney Houston\'s 1985 hit song "Saving All My Love for You". He later played Private Ricco Frost in the film "Aliens" (1986), and also appeared in the films "Death Wish 3" (1985), "Spies Like Us" (1985), "" (1985 TV film), "Displaced Person" (1985 episode of "American Playhouse"), "Gulliver\'s Travels" (1996), "" (1996), "Fierce Creatures" (1997), "Nate and the Colonel" (2003) and "Hydra" (2009).\n', 'Zvee Scooler (December 1, 1899 – March 25, 1985) was a Russian-born American actor and radio commentator. He was born in Kamenets-Podolsky (now Ukraine). He performed in both Yiddish and English, on the stage, television, and film. He is probably best known for his roles in "Fiddler on the Roof", playing the innkeeper in the Broadway play and the rabbi in the film version. Another of his more notable roles was that of Boris\' father in Woody Allen\'s "Love and Death".\n', 'BULLET::::- Barold "Barry" Frost (Lee Thompson Young) (Seasons 1–4): Rizzoli\'s second partner. A whiz when it comes to computers and technology, he is terrified of dead bodies and becomes ill at the sight of blood. He is very protective of Jane and stands by her like a loyal, tough partner. In the season five premiere, he is killed off in a car accident while returning from vacation, due in part to the actor\'s death in 2013. In the season five finale, the team establish the Barry Frost Memorial Scholarship, intended for students who are academically gifted and seek to go into professions that would help others but lack the resources to do so.\n']

Answer:

**Knowledge Enhanced Inference Process:**

The actor who played Barry Frost on "Rizzoli & Isles" is Lee Thompson Young. He was a talented actor known for his role on the show, appearing in Seasons 1–4. Tragically, he passed away in 2013, and his death was ruled a suicide, which shocked many fans and colleagues. The show addressed his passing by killing off his character in the season five premiere, where Barry Frost died in a car accident while returning from vacation. This narrative decision was made in light of Young's real-life death.

In honor of Lee Thompson Young, the series established the Barry Frost Memorial Scholarship in the season five finale. This scholarship is intended for academically gifted students who aspire to help others but lack the resources to do so. The actor who played Frost on "Rizzoli & Isles," Lee Thompson Young, passed away in 2013. His death was ruled a suicide, which shocked many fans and colleagues. In response to his passing, the show killed off his character in the season five premiere, where Barry Frost died in a car accident while returning from vacation. Additionally, the series established the Barry Frost Memorial Scholarship to honor his memory, aimed at supporting academically gifted students who wish to help others but lack resources.

question_info.question: what happened to the actor who played frost on rizzoli and isles
passages:
Ri’chard was considered for the role of Barry Frost in Rizzoli & Isles but the role was given to Lee Thompson Young.
Swifty Lazar appears as a character in Peter Morgan's stage play "Frost/Nixon", first staged at the Donmar Warehouse, London on August 10, 2006 and played by actor Kerry Shale. In the play, Lazar negotiates a deal with David Frost on behalf of President Richard Nixon for Frost to interview Nixon. The play is closely based on real-life events. He was also portrayed by Toby Jones in the 2008 film version of "Frost/Nixon". Swifty Lazar also appeared, thinly disguised as Irving "Sneaky" LaSalle, in George Axelrod's 1956 take on Dr. Faustus, the play "Will Success Spoil Rock Hunter" where Sneaky as an agent, will get his clients absolutely anything they want for 10% of their soul. The Lazar role was played on Broadway by Martin Gable.
Ross' first television role was as an extra on "The Young and the Restless", which was followed by a small part in "Hill Street Blues" and the male lead in the music video for Whitney Houston's 1985 hit song "Saving All My Love for You". He later played Private Ricco Frost in the film "Aliens" (1986), and also appeared in the films "Death Wish 3" (1985), "Spies Like Us" (1985), "" (1985 TV film), "Displaced Person" (1985 episode of "American Playhouse"), "Gulliver's Travels" (1996), "" (1996), "Fierce Creatures" (1997), "Nate and the Colonel" (2003) and "Hydra" (2009).
Zvee Scooler (December 1, 1899 – March 25, 1985) was a Russian-born American actor and radio commentator. He was born in Kamenets-Podolsky (now Ukraine). He performed in both Yiddish and English, on the stage, television, and film. He is probably best known for his roles in "Fiddler on the Roof", playing the innkeeper in the Broadway play and the rabbi in the film version. Another of his more notable roles was that of Boris' father in Woody Allen's "Love and Death".
BULLET::::- Barold "Barry" Frost (Lee Thompson Young) (Seasons 1–4): Rizzoli's second partner. A whiz when it comes to computers and technology, he is terrified of dead bodies and becomes ill at the sight of blood. He is very protective of Jane and stands by her like a loyal, tough partner. In the season five premiere, he is killed off in a car accident while returning from vacation, due in part to the actor's death in 2013. In the season five finale, the team establish the Barry Frost Memorial Scholarship, intended for students who are academically gifted and seek to go into professions that would help others but lack the resources to do so.
